publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-98 Brian Adam: Education Authorities Inspection Report on Schools in Aberdeen—That the Parliament notes with concern the conclusions of the second education authorities inspection report on schools in Aberdeen which reveals a number of deficiencies in the provision of primary and secondary education in Aberdeen under previous council administrations, such as a dramatic increase in the number of exclusions and a general failure to support pupils with behavioural and emotional difficulties; also notes with concern that the report identifies a widening gulf between the academic achievements of pupils from schools in affluent areas and areas of greater social need; recognises that, although this report is highly critical, Aberdeen City Council has already taken great steps to address the main points for action, and wishes it well in its endeavours.
S3M-98 Education Authorities Inspection Report on Schools in Aberdeen (lodged on 30 May 2007) Willie Coffey*, Bill Wilson*, Michael Matheson*, Nigel Don*, Christina McKelvie*
